results.title: Association between beta-blocker use and obesity in Hong Kong Chinese elders: a post-hoc analysis.
results.text_hl: After adjusting for other weight-altering drugs, beta-blockers remained a significant predictor of @DISEASE_Overweight @DISEASE_MESH:D050177 @@@overweight@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@ (P=0.001). As the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population had significantly higher BMI than the normotensive population (24.3+-3.6 vs 22.9+-3.5, P<0.001), a sub-analysis on those with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ diagnosis confirmed that only the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ had a significantly larger population of @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ individuals (BMI >=25) compared with those who took @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (58.9% vs 38.5%, P=0.03) and those who did not take any beta-blockers (58.9% vs 38.4%, P=0.007).

citations.NLM: Leung KL, Fong W, Freedman B, Bajorek B, Lee VWY. Association between beta-blocker use and obesity in Hong Kong Chinese elders: a post-hoc analysis. Hong Kong Med J. 2020 Feb;26(1):27-34. PMID: 32051330
citations.BibTeX: @article{32051330, title={Association between beta-blocker use and obesity in Hong Kong Chinese elders: a post-hoc analysis.}, author={Leung KL and Fong W and Freedman B and Bajorek B and Lee VWY}, journal={Hong Kong Med J}, volume={26}, number={1}, pages={27-34}}

results.title: [Atenolol poisoning].
results.text_hl: ...A 44-year-old @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ female @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ ingested 200 mg @CHEMICAL_Diazepam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003975 @@@diazepam@@@ and 1000 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ with suicidal intent.

results.title: Comparative pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of propranolol and atenolol in normolipaemic and hyperlipidaemic obese subjects.
results.text_hl: The concentrations of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ were significantly lower in both normolipaemic and hyperlipidaemic @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ subjects.

citations.NLM: Wójcicki J, Jaroszynska M, Droździk M, Pawlik A, Gawrońska-Szklarz B, Sterna R. Comparative pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of propranolol and atenolol in normolipaemic and hyperlipidaemic obese subjects. Biopharm Drug Dispos. 2003 Jul;24(5):211-8. PMID: 12784321

results.title: Antenatal exposure to atenolol and retroperitoneal fibromatosis.
results.text_hl: A 25-year-old @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ was treated for @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ with 100 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ daily from the second month until the end of pregnancy.

results.title: Effects of antihypertensive therapy on glucose and insulin metabolism and on left ventricular mass: A randomized, double-blind, controlled study of 21 obese hypertensives.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: In @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ individuals, adequate and similar blood pressure control was achieved with @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Kuperstein R, Sasson Z. Effects of antihypertensive therapy on glucose and insulin metabolism and on left ventricular mass: A randomized, double-blind, controlled study of 21 obese hypertensives. Circulation. 2000 Oct 10;102(15):1802-6. PMID: 11023935
